content.text: Standing in a crawling movement touching the floor at 6 points: 2 palms open wide, 2 knees and both the front of the legs and feet and rocking.  While crawling on 6 the body points, pulling  himself to one side where he puts all his weight and lifts his other side and then switch to the other side and vice versa.

Making the shoulder belt muscles strong and ready for a good fine motor  skills that are coming when the baby starts to sit by himself. Upper body and lower body are working together and it is very important for the milestones to come.  Here too the hand and foot coordination is happening and if not passing the army crawl stage this is the time for the body to work on it and increase the connection of the nerve system in the brain.
At this stage the level of independence increases due to the ability to explore more of their surroundings and the level of curiosity rises.
